total_revenue.context: Net sales increased 11% to $158.9 billion in the third quarter of 2024, compared with $143.1 billion in Q3 2023. Excluding the $0.2 billion unfavorable impact from year-over-year changes in foreign exchange rates throughout the quarter, net sales increased by 11% compared with Q3 2023.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $0.2 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America segment sales increased 9% year-over-year to $95.5 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $89.874 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_income.context: North America segment operating income was $5.7 billion in Q3 2024, compared with operating income of $4.3 billion in Q3 2023.

net_sales.context: International segment sales increased 12% year-over-year to $35.9 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International increased to $34.587 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_income.context: International segment operating income was $1.3 billion in Q3 2024, compared with an operating loss of ($0.1) billion in Q3 2023.

net_sales.context: AWS segment sales increased 19% year-over-year to $27.5 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $17.005 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_income.context: AWS segment operating income was $10.4 billion in Q3 2024, compared with operating income of $7.0 billion in Q3 2023.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $158.9 billion in Q3 2024, up 11% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $141.466 billion in Q3 2024, up from $131.895 billion in Q3 2023.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $17.4 billion in Q3 2024, compared with $11.2 billion in Q3 2023.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q3 2024 were $141.466 billion, up 5.44% from Q3 2023.
key_factors: Continued inflationary pressures affecting operational costs
Ongoing investments in fulfillment and transportation infrastructure
Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold was $193 million in Q3 2024.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses were $696 million in Q3 2024.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses were $2.961 billion in Q3 2024.

Marketing.context: Marketing expenses were $1.012 billion in Q3 2024.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses were $0.471 billion in Q3 2024.

Other.context: Worldwide shipping costs were $23.501 billion in Q3 2024.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $5.333 billion in Q3 2024.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $17.4 billion in Q3 2024, compared with $11.2 billion in Q3 2023.

net_income.context: Net income was $15.3 billion in Q3 2024, compared with $9.9 billion in Q3 2023.

eps.context: Net income of $15.3 billion translates to $1.43 per diluted share in Q3 2024, compared with $0.94 per diluted share in Q3 2023.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow increased to $47.7 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $21.4 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2023.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 57% to $112.7 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $71.7 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2023.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations increased to $44.9 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $15.9 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2023.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations increased to $46.1 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $20.2 billion for the trailing twelve months ended September 30, 2023.

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures details not provided in the Q3 2024 financial results.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the Q3 2024 financial results.

daily_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q3 2024 financial results.

monthly_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the Q3 2024 financial results.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,551,000 in Q3 2024, up 3% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to enhance its market leadership across e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and other innovative sectors.
initiatives: Held its annual Prime Big Deal Days shopping event, with record sales, number of items sold, and Prime member participation, saving Prime members more than $1 billion with deals across its Store.
Announced its first-ever fuel savings offer for Prime, saving U.S. members 10 cents a gallon on fuel at approximately 7,000 bp, Amoco, and ampm locations.
Expanded its selection of brands with AllSaints, Beats x Kim, Estée Lauder, kate spade new york, and more.

Announced plans to expand Amazon Pharmacy Same-Day Delivery of medications to nearly half the U.S. in 2025 by accelerating the rollout of new pharmacies in 20 more U.S. cities by the end of next year.
Launched new generative AI-powered features, including Rufus, AI Shopping Guides, Project Amelia, and video generation capabilities for advertisers.
Released 19 films and series from Amazon MGM Studios, including Fallout, Season 4 of The Boys, and The Idea of You.
Secured expansive streaming rights for the NBA for 11 seasons, starting in 2025-26.
Became the exclusive home of Monday Night National Hockey League games in Canada.
Launched Anthropic Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Meta Llama 3.1, and Mistral Large 2 models in Amazon Bedrock.
Shared that companies like AXA, DoorDash, Nasdaq, Rocket Insurance, SAP, Thomson Reuters, Workday, WPP, and Zendesk announced new applications built on Bedrock.
Delivered new AWS Graviton4-based compute instances, providing up to 30% better price-performance than the industry-leading AWS Graviton3 instances.

Signed AWS agreements with several large enterprise companies such as The Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Limited, Booking.com, Capital One, Datadog, Epic Games, Fast Retailing, Itaú Unibanco, Luma AI, National Australia Bank, Sony, T-Mobile, Toyota, and Veeva.
Launched Season 2 of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power to positive reviews from customers and critics alike, ranking as Prime Video’s most watched returning season ever by hours watched.
Drew more than 17 million viewers to the Cowboys-Giants Thursday Night Football game, the most-streamed NFL regular season game ever.
Added Apple TV+ to Prime Video’s collection of over 100 add-on subscription channels in the U.S.
Announced a new Kindle lineup, including a reimagined Kindle Scribe with generative AI, the Kindle Colorsoft with a color display, and the fastest Kindle Paperwhite ever.

Announced investments in the Delivery Service Partner program of $2.1 billion in North America to support safety programs, training, incentives, and more, as well as 25 billion yen in Japan to support last mile delivery innovation, and safety and technology for drivers.

Announced plans to hire 250,000 people across its U.S. operations ahead of the holiday season. All seasonal employees earn at least $18 per hour and have access to comprehensive benefits like health care.
Announced plans for AWS to invest £8 billion over five years in the UK, supporting 14,000 jobs annually.

Removed plastic air pillows from all delivery packaging at fulfillment centers globally, including expanding its use of paper filler made from 100% recycled content across North America to replace plastic air pillows.

Mobilized Disaster Relief by Amazon to support communities around the world impacted by natural disasters. In the U.S., Amazon leveraged its Disaster Relief Hub in Atlanta to support communities impacted by Hurricanes Helene and Milton with donated goods, logistics support, and technology. In Europe, Amazon mobilized its global logistics infrastructure, inventory, teams, and technology to provide rapid assistance for flooding across the region.
goals: Maintain leadership in e-commerce and cloud services
Expand technological innovations in AI, machine learning, and infrastructure
Enhance customer satisfaction and service offerings
Support small and medium-sized businesses
Drive innovation in health services through acquisitions like One Medical
Strengthen international market presence
Enhance brand protection and anti-counterfeiting efforts
Continue expanding AWS infrastructure and partnerships
Accelerate growth in generative AI and related technologies

innovation.description: Amazon is focused on innovation across its platforms including AWS, Alexa, Prime Video, and new hardware devices to enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.
initiatives: Launched new generative AI-powered features, including Rufus, AI Shopping Guides, Project Amelia, and video generation capabilities for advertisers.

Released new foundation models in Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, including AI21 Labs’ Jamba 1.5 family, Anthropic’s upgraded Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Meta’s Llama 3.2, Mistral Large 2, and multiple Stability AI models.
Delivered new AWS Graviton4-based compute instances, providing up to 30% better price-performance.
Introduced Oracle Database@AWS for easy migration of Oracle workloads to AWS.
Entered a strategic collaboration with Databricks to accelerate development of custom models built with Databricks Mosaic AI on AWS.
Launched new memory-optimized, compute-optimized, and general purpose Amazon EC2 instances based on AWS’s latest generation Graviton4 processor.
Developed AI capabilities like SageMaker for model builders, Bedrock for frontier models, Trainium for cost-efficient compute, and Q for advanced GenAI assistance.
goals: Provide advanced security and database services through AWS
Enhance user interaction with Alexa
Expand digital content offerings globally
Improve smart home security solutions
Develop autonomous and cloud-based technologies
Foster customer-driven product development through innovative programs
Introduce innovative payment solutions with Amazon One and Venmo
Enhance in-vehicle entertainment and connectivity
Integrate Alexa with multiple voice assistants on single devices
Increase advertiser and agency engagement with real-time marketing insights
Advance generative AI technologies and integrations across Amazon platforms
examples: Launched Rufus, a generative AI expert shopping assistant, available in multiple countries.
Introduced AI Shopping Guides to simplify product research using generative AI.
Developed Project Amelia, an AI assistant for sellers offering tailored business insights.
Released new foundation models in Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker.
Delivered new AWS Graviton4-based compute instances with enhanced performance.
Introduced Oracle Database@AWS for seamless migration of Oracle workloads.
Collaborated with Databricks to enhance Mosaic AI on AWS.
Launched new EC2 instances based on the latest Graviton4 processor.
Developed advanced AI capabilities like SageMaker, Bedrock, Trainium, and Q.

acquisitions.description: Amazon continues to grow through strategic acquisitions to enhance its product and service offerings.
initiatives: Acquired One Medical, integrating its services into Amazon's health offerings.
Filing legal action against orchestrators of fake reviews to protect brand integrity.
goals: Strengthen market position in key sectors
Enhance technological capabilities and service offerings
Accelerate growth in digital media and content
Expand health services through acquisitions like One Medical
examples: Acquisition of One Medical, adding primary care services to Amazon's health offerings.
Legal actions against more than 11,000 websites and social media groups orchestrating fake reviews.

social_initiatives.description: Amazon is committed to supporting its employees and communities, especially during challenging times.
initiatives: Ranked No. 2 on LinkedIn’s Top Companies list and No. 1 in the technology sector.
Announced that all electricity consumed by Amazon’s operations, including its data centers, was matched with 100% renewable energy in 2023.
Replaced 95% of plastic air pillows in Amazon’s delivery packaging in North America with paper filler.
Announced an additional $1.4 billion commitment to Amazon's Housing Equity Fund for affordable housing.
goals: Ensure the safety and well-being of employees
Maintain operational continuity during crises
Support communities and essential workers
Provide industry-leading pay and benefits
Foster long-term innovation and strategic growth
Expand international job creation and fulfillment capabilities
Protect customers and brands from counterfeit and fraudulent activities
Promote sustainability and environmental responsibility
Support affordable housing initiatives for communities.

revenue_growth.expectation: Net sales are expected to be between $181.5 billion and $188.5 billion, or to grow between 7% and 11% compared with fourth quarter 2023.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Excluding the unfavorable impact of approximately 10 basis points from foreign exchange rates.

Successful integration of Just Walk Out Technology in additional grocery stores
Innovations in shopping experiences and expansion of fulfillment network productivity

leadership_transition.description: Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder and former CEO, transitioned to the role of Executive Chair in Q3 2021, and Andy Jassy became Chief Executive Officer at that time.
leadership_transition.context: Jeff Bezos stepped down to focus on long-term strategic initiatives and innovation, while Andy Jassy, head of AWS, took over as CEO to lead Amazon's continued growth.
